body.p:
Christian Circuit Court
March Term 1864
The Commonwealth of Ky
vs } on Indictment for "stabbing"
Malcom ^C^ McFaddin

"The Commonwealths attorney appeared, and Malcom C McFaddin with J T Savage and T Yateman Clark having entered into a recognizance before D T Hays police Judge of the town of Hopkinsville on the 22 day of July 1862, in the sum of Two Hundred dollars for the appearance of said McFaddin in this court to answer for stabbing Wm Withy and said McFaddin not so appearing although called. It is ordered that said Recognizance be forfeited, and it is further ordered that a summons he issued thereon against said McFaddin J T Savage & T Y Clark to appear in this court on the 1st day of its next September Term to show cause why execution should not be issued for the amount of said Recognizance, and a Bench warrant is awarded herein bail fixed in the Sum of $200"
The Recognizance executed by the said J T Savage & T Yateman Clark for the appearance of the said McFaddin is as follows viz:

"Police Judges Court
Hopkinsville Christian County Kentucky

Malcom C McFaddin in custody charged with the offense of stabbing William Withy in a sudden affray in the town of Hopkinsville on the 21st day of July 1862. and being admitted to bail in the sum of Two Hundred Dollars

Now we J T Savage & T Yateman Clark of Christian County Kentucky hereby undertake that the above named Malcom C McFaddin will appear in the Christian Circuit Court on the first day of its next September term to answer ^said^ charge, and will at all times render himself amenable to the orders & process of said Court in the prosecution of said charge and if convicted will render himself in execution thereof, or if he shall fail to perform either of these conditions, that we will pay to the Commonwealth of Kentucky the Sum of Two Hundred Dollars witness our hands this 22d day of July 1862

J T Savage
T Y Clark
Taken & Subscribed before- as police Judge of Hopkisnville

D T Hays Police Judge of Hopkinsville Ky-
A Copy Att-
Hacob Clark C C C C
per A H Clark D. C
